content: this legal text summarizes a case that is being heard in the county court of pula in the 2nd instance the case was initially heard in the municipal court of pazin in the 1st instance the case involves the dissolution of a coownership community of real estate properties the proposer of the resolution became the individual owner of specific properties while the opposing party also became the individual owner of their own set of properties in this text the court orders the proposer to pay the opposing party a certain amount of money and grants the opposing party the right to a lien on a real estate property the court instructs the land registry department to register this right of ownership the opposing party is then ordered to reimburse the applicant for the costs of the procedure the courts decision is based on principles of property law and takes into account factors such as coownership shares property status location and value as well as expert opinions the court concludes that the claimant had the right to dissolve the coownership and determines the division of the properties the court finds that the decision of the first instance court was correct and lawful and dismisses the appellants appeal
